intro: Sideritis pungens subsp. javalambrensis, commonly known as the Javalambrense Sideritis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, pale blue or purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its leaves are often hairy and have a mild, slightly minty scent.
